SEARCH
Package io

Class Input_Parser

java.lang.Object
io.Input_Parser
public class Input_Parser extends Object
A utility class responsible for parsing simulation parameters from different sources, primarily from a text file or from command-line arguments (for random generation). It translates raw input into a structured SimulationParameters object.

  • Method Details

    • parseFile

      public SimulationParameters parseFile(String filePath) throws IOException
      Reads and parses simulation parameters from a specified file path. The file is expected to follow a specific format: The first line contains main simulation parameters (grid dimensions, start/end points, counts for special zones/obstacles, and simulation constants). Subsequent sections (if Nscz or Nobst are greater than 0) detail special cost zones and obstacle coordinates.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the input file containing simulation parameters.
      Returns:
      A SimulationParameters object populated with the parsed values.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file, or if the file format is invalid.
      NumberFormatException - If any numeric value in the file cannot be parsed.

    • parseArgs

      public SimulationParameters parseArgs(String[] args)
      Parses simulation parameters provided as command-line arguments in "random" mode. This mode is indicated by the first argument being "-r". The subsequent 15 arguments represent the main simulation parameters. Special cost zones and obstacles are generated randomly based on the provided counts (nscz, nobst) and grid dimensions.
      Parameters:
      args - An array of strings representing the command-line arguments. Expected format: `"-r" n m xi yi xf yf nscz nobst tau nu nuMax k mu delta rho`
      Returns:
      A SimulationParameters object populated with the parsed and randomly generated values.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the command-line arguments do not match the expected format or count.
      NumberFormatException - If any argument expected to be a number cannot be parsed.
